page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The name {CRAILING}may come from Crailyn meaning brisk pool-refer ing to the Oxnam Water.{ECKFORD}means oak ford-still recognised on the Teviot. The earliest evidence of man is in Eckford where Burial Cists and the site of an ancient dwelling have been found. Eckford was once a sizable village. There was a Pele Tower and another nearby at Moss Tower. They and the village were destroyed by English invaders in the 1500's. In the 1700's local farmers were noted Improvers. They enclosed fields,drained and manured them and grew crops such as cereals,flax,turnips and even tobacco. A marel pit was dug which is now Wooden Loch. Wooden Hill was first planted with trees then. Twice weekly coaches between Hawick and Kelso ran along a turnpike providing communication.
